Reviews.Title: “Good service and lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: luisSR36
Reviews.Content: In the heart of San Diego and close to the Bay, Bayside Inn is a good place to be. There is an excellent service, quick and respectfull. The rooms are clean, spacious and loaded with the minimum things you would need. I found an iron with an iron-board that I used right away. The room has also a microwave, and a small refrigetator. However, the refrigetator was empty. It is there for your use, if ou have something to put in. I would have liked better to find some cold drinks, which could have been charged to my account. Place has also a small swimming pool with warm water and a hot tub. In the morning, starting at 6:30am, they offer Continental Breakfast Buffet, which is really good. Scrambed eggs, potatoes, fruit, orange juice and apple juice, as well as oatmeal, bread, coffee and other things. So far, breakfast was excellent. The only complain that I have is that I could hear the noise of a train passing by.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal/excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dianne228
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western before our cruise. The rooms were clean and comfortable with small patios overlooking the bay. We had a couple of minor problems initially with TV and phone but these were taken care of immediately by the staff. Staff were couteous and helpful. We were able to purchase tickets for the zoo and trolley tour at the hotel. A very good breakfast was provided free with a variety of choices including eggs and waffles. This hotel is within walking distown of Litttle Italy, Embarcadaro and Downtown San Diego. It is also close to airport and cruise terminal and provides a free shuttle to these locations. Make sure you pre-book shuttle to cruise terminal. The morning we left it seemed as though the entire hotel were heading to their cruises. It appeared somewhat chaotic and a number of people were rude and complaining. The staff handles this well and added a second shuttle. We had booked the shuttle for 1300 and were delayed only by 20 minutes. Considering the number of people waiting for the shuttle I felt this was very good service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Post cruise”
Reviews.Author: B0bT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel post cruise, I bid on the room thru Orbitz and stayed for about $125/night. The room was comfortable and the location was convenient. We walked to the Little Italy district the first evening and had a great Italian Diner at Chianiti, which the front desk recommended. We had a car rental (parking was $10/night, going to $14/night 4-1-12) which made our stay very enjoyable. We walked every night, close to the water front, there is a lot to see in San Diego, a beautiful city, it would be a great place to live. Don't miss Balboa Park, Coronado Island & Point Loma, we started to La Jolla, but got into rush hour traffic and turned around, would have liked to seen the zoo, you can do only so much in 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal/great view”
Reviews.Author: travelaton28
Reviews.Content: A nicely renovated hotel. Great private balconies. Standard breakfast. Walking distance to lots of great restaurants in little Italy. Close to airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely views.”
Reviews.Author: AarondQueensland
Reviews.Content: Our Bayview room was spacious and clean. The hotel was in a great location with easy walking distance to Little Italy and the Embarcadero. The tram and trolley stop were very close by. The hotel provided a lovely breakfast and the restaurant is also open for dinner if you arrive back late. We ate here one night and it was lovely, staff friendly and service great. Reception was great and very helpful with organising tours or giving directions. We would be happy to stay here again, they also provided a free shuttle service to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: KCJudy
Reviews.Content: After much "research" on hotels in San Diego, I decided on this Best Western property for a Spring Break trip with my 17 year-old and his friend. First off, the hotel offers free airport shuttle service. My primary goals in selecting a hotel were to be close to the trolley/bus line so I wouldn't have the expense of renting a car, to have breakfast included in the room price, and to be centrally-located in a safe area. This Best Western fit the bill! The staff was extremely helpful and courteous, the room was a decent size for 3 people and was very clean and comfortable. There was a cute little balcony with a great view of the city. We only had to walk a few blocks to Little Italy, the trolley stop, the Gaslamp Quarter, and the Embarcadero. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: noskill
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for a Spring Break trip and enjoyed our stay. I liked how close the hotel is to the airport. We enjoyed the delicious breakfast each morning. Our only complaint was the outside noise (train and street) that we could hear in the room. The bed was very comfortable and the shower had plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: kat4man4du
Reviews.Content: Everytime I have gone to San Diego for work, the company has put us up at the Best Western Plus Bayside Inn. The hotel is resonable, clean and the staff is friendly and other than a few minor occasions with guests, it is fairly quiet. It is centrally located in the downtown area close to the airport, The Gas Lamp District, the Harbor, Little Italy and the MTS Trains. The only issues I have with this hotel is that there is no room service for dinner on the weekends and the attached restaurant is not open after breakfast on Sat or Sun. and dependig on the room, the wireless internet can be spotty. Other than that I would stay there even if I went for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Plus Bayside Inn is a definite pick on my list for San Diego hotels. A bit removed from the Gas Lamp District is reflected in their fair pricing. Rooms are very clean, the bed is comfortable, and we were provided a nice view of the bay (somewhat blocked but never-the-less, a view.) Breakfast is included as well. The train does run by the hotel by a couple of blocks, however, it certainly doesn't influence my opinion of the hotel. The desk staff was very friendly, accommodating and customer service oriented. Parking was easy in their lot, although a few tight turns here and there. Parking fees are dramatically lower at this hotel then the hotels one mile away in the Gas Lamp district. Definitely use the designated check-in spaces to unload your luggage and then park (no elevators in the parking structure.) Two elevators service the hotel, therefore, allow a few minutes extra if you're on a time constraint as there is a bit of a wait during the prime-time check-out period! Overall, a nice, comfortable, economical and safe place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: anamgarcia
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location: near downtown and just a few steps to little italy. Our room had a very good size and a very confortable bed. Our room was on the 8th floor and we had a great bay view. During the day is a little bit noisy because the train station is near by .The breakfast was very good. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fancy hotel but worths what it costs”
Reviews.Author: ED7707
Reviews.Content: My room was ok, clean, good size; the breakfast was not really good, but fill your stomach. Great location, a couple of blocks from Little Italy, Friendly Staff especially Moises.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Janice B
Reviews.Content: Our stay was Jan. 18 & 19th 2012. Great place to spend your pre-cruise time. The room was clean and comfortable. We never made it to the pool but it looked nice. You could hear the train in our room facing the bay, but not too bad. We were on the 8th floor. Elevators were good. The staff were very freindly. The restaurant next door had excellent service but could have had a bigger menu. The hotel was in walking distance to Seaport Village, Little Italy, and to the shore where we spent most of our time walking around and going whale watching. Our only complaint was the water temp. in the shower flucuates.

Reviews.Title: “october 2011”
Reviews.Author: whitwickboy
Reviews.Content: well we only stayed here for 2 nights, we were touring the states, but not only is it excellently situated but everything you want is within a 5 min walk. The staff were friendly, the rooms secure and clean and breakfast, as far as we were conserned decent, i have read a lot of negative comments on this hotel and sorry but as a traveller to " the states " on a regular basis i think this hotel is really good. If you want to be treated like royalty nip over the bridge to the hotel corinado and loose your mortgage, yes we stayed there as well and not a patch on the location of this hotel ! We will be back xxx

Reviews.Title: “Nifty, thrifty, friendly Bayside”
Reviews.Author: piratequeenLondon
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, with a view of the Bay,okay a partial one. Save your pennies, for food and drinks. How long do you spend in your room anyway, but while you are there its more than good value. It has a heated pool and jaccusi. The staff are helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were a bit basic, but again, its included in the price. Location very handy for Little Italy, close enough to walk to the promenade, within walking distance of the trolley line and Coaster line for the beaches and coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aiden D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed for two nights. Really easy to get to if your coming from LA. CLose to Sea World as well. The Restaurant that is attached is beautiful. The staff at the front desk couldnt have been more friendly. The rooms are spacious and clean and we had a great view of the port.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: lil_londoner88
Reviews.Content: San Diego was my 3rd stop on my USA trip in September 2011. We flew in from San Francisco on an early flight, and arrived at the hotel via taxi at around 9am. We were able to leave our luggage in a storage cupboard, so we could go out for the day and return later to check in. I believe we arrived on Labor Day, so San Diego in itself was very quiet. We spent the day at Seaworld, which was really easy to get to from the Bayside Inn (take the trolley from the Santa Fe Depot to Old Town and then take a bus right to the gates). Our room was on the 11th floor and it had a great view out to the ocean. Facilities in the room were all adequate. Comfy bed, good working shower, tv with variety of channels, free wifi and working safe. My only issue with the room was at night, the trains were very loud. But you'd have this problem at any hotel in this area. Free breakfast was included, but it wasn't anything fantastic. Good if you are a budget traveller though. Upon checking out of the hotel, we used the free shuttle to take us and our suitcases to the Santa Fe Depot. The driver was very friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel, however I think if I was to return to San Diego, I would stay elsewhere as the area was not as I expected.

Reviews.Title: “close to gaslight district”
Reviews.Author: bitterntraveller
Reviews.Content: 10th floor room with small balcony. Noise limited, breakfast inckuded - good selection. Friendly staff, free wifi, parking $10/night

Reviews.Title: “If your exploring San Diego this is a good place to rest”
Reviews.Author: BSNRN
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Bayside and will stay again when visiting San Diego. If your looking for a great location to bed down for the night this is it. A 5-10 minute walk to Little Italy, the bay, Gas light District, or the main trolley and train station, just what a explorer needs. My wife and I stayed 5 nights and enjoyed the sunsets of the bay from our balcony. We slept with the sliding doors open (6th floor) soaking in the sounds of the city. The clanging of the trolley bell which stops at 11 pm or the sounder, breeze, or Amtrak trains as it goes by we both slept very well each night. The staff was very friendly again, all had smiles and said good morning or afternoon or night depending when they saw you. A big difference with this visit was the fact the elevators seemed faster with a minimal wait to go up or come down from your room. One suggestion I would have is offer a little better breakfast, ie maybe a daily meat and potatoes. Each breakfast I had to order hash browns because no potatoes were offered and I also had to order sausage, bacon, or ham.

Reviews.Title: “Might get stuck in a smoking room!”
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room over two months ago prior to a friend reserving theirs and we got stuck in a smoking room that smelled terrible. Upon check in we were not told that they had put us in a smoking room. We discovered it when we walked into the room and got hit with the extreme smoke smell. We immediately contacted the front desk and asked to be moved, but were told they were completely full and all they had left were smoking rooms. So we were charged the same price for an outdated, smelly room with a view of a parking garage as our friends who had a non smoking room, updated with a view of the bay! We asked how it was possible they could put us in a smoking room and they informed us it was based on when the reservations were made. Interesting since our friends made their reservation a week after us. We did ask for a discounted price at check out and were told they could not authorize that. I have no plans to ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Rose A
Reviews.Content: One of the worst experiences I have ever had. The water distribution for bathing was either scalding hot or freezing cold, no matter where you placed the gauge. The train is very loud in the morning and the free breakfast isn't anything to brag about, you're better off walking to Starbucks and buying a muffin and coffee, not to mention the additional fees that were addressed when I was checking out. You will get charged a service fee for shuttles, even if you never used them. Oh and let's not forget the static reception on the T.V. The only good thing about this hotel was the free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel For the Money”
Reviews.Author: Sledhead43
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel for the money. Great location with many options of things to do. Great beds and clean rooms. Service is excellent, Front desk and airport suttle. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: daylilly50
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here twice on our recent visit to San Diego (First and Last nights).We loved the location- easy walk to Little Italy, the harbor, and Gas Lamp. The area is changing rapidly with expensive new apartment houses going up all around. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly, and it was wonderful to have free service to and from the airport. In additon there was a complimentary buffet breakfast, but that could use some improvement. The rooms were lovely, clean and large plasma tv's. Perfect for stays where you need to be near the port for a cruise or the airport. It was convenient to the highways too, so it should also be considered if you are visiting many of the area attractions.We did see many more older tourists than families though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Vicki288
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in San Diego staying at this hotel. Perfect location to so many attractions. Just a 5 minute walk to the bay. Beautiful view of the water from our room. Room was very clean and had the amenities we wanted. Microwave, fridge, safe, coffee maker. free breakfast and one of the cheaper places to park. ($10.00 per night) Also this was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Just minutes to I5 to get to Coronado, La Jolla and many other attractions. We found the desk staff to be very friendly and helpful with directions etc. The only thing I would improve and I am being very picky here is the breakfast. It was very good with lots of choices but in todays more health conscious times it really needed more fruit. Will certainly return to this hotel next time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for San Diego on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: BostonVacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in early October for a San Diego vacation. If you are planning to do a lot in San Diego and need to save on accommodations, parking, and breakfasts then this is a great option. Our room was clean, modern, and comfortable with a great bed. We enjoyed a small balcony looking out over the city streets. The surrounding area was quiet with the exception of the nearby Amtrak crossing which we could not hear from our room on the East side of the hotel. Parking was $10 per night which is an excellent deal when compared to other hotels in the surrounding area. The included breakfast was more than adequate- bagels, yogurt, toast, scrambled eggs, hash browns, juice, and coffee. The hotel pool is very small and enclosed within the hotel's inner court. If you are looking to relax by a tranquil pool, this would not be for you. The hotel is well located just 3 short blocks from Harbor Drive. We were easy walking distance to Little Italy, the Embarcadero, the USS Midway Museum, Seaport Village, and the Santa Fe Depot. Five minute drive to the Gaslamp District and Horton Plaza. Ten minute drive to Balboa Park and Zoo. Very easy freeway access to Coronado, Old Town, Ocean Beach, Mission Beach, Pacific Beach, La Jolla, and surrounding areas. The hotel is clean and staff were polite. As budget conscious travelers that would rather spend our vacation dollars on seeing the sights, we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at best”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night en route to alternate destination, then back a week later for one more night. Left a piece of luggage there for the week with no issues. Location, facilities, price all average. Agree with other reviewers that the front desk staff was somewhat disinterested as well. My issue is the lack of security. Both stays I had multiple local restaurant flyers pushed under my door during the evening. As a solo female traveller, this is not something I want to see. Nothing draws me back to this hotel so would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Bedding:)”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda C
Reviews.Content: The bed's have fresh clean linens that made me feel like I was in a fine hotel. They even have clean duvet covers so you don't have to wonder when the last time the spread was washed. It was in a fabulous location close to Little Italy, the ports and walking distance to Gaslamp district. They is a train that will take you anywhere you need to go in San Diego near by. The breakfast was lacking a little but for free, who's to complain. Oh speaking of free, parking is very hard to find in San Diego and 95% of hotels charge, this one does not. The pool is kinda small and not very inviting but being so close to the water kinda negates this. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it really”
Reviews.Author: jontyb
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good spot, clean, safe, comfy beds and quiet. Note my 4/5 rating so I'll focus on the poor points: Pool not worth bothering with, could do with some fruit at breakfast and 1 coffee filter is not enough. TV image quality is very poor, you end up giving up and turning off.The train that passess regularly (including 3 in the morning) cannot be helped but will disturb your sleep (otherwise exceptionally quiet hotel) - triple glazing or ear plugs may help but this is the centre of town and all hotels are affected by the same.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an ok location”
Reviews.Author: kengedahl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 8 nights and overall the stay was nice. The staff does not seem to be interested in the guests very much but an occasional smile was however received from one or two of the staff. Furthermore the receptionists do not seem to take any notice of the people entering the hotel which seemed a little strange. The rooms are quite big and nice. I had a room with a bay view which was nice. An old CRT television with questionable reception, a microwave, a coffemaker, in-room safe and a refrigerator was part of the room. The in-room safe was big enough for a 13" computer. The condition of the room was sparkless clean for the whole of my stay. One strange thing though is that each floor holds rooms for both smoking and not smoking. And the rooms are not sealed so you can actually smell the smoke in the hallway. I did not stay next to a smoking room and I did not smell any smoke in my room. Also on my floor there seemed to be a very loud AC or similar which I actually could here from my room 3 rooms away from the noise. There is also wi-fi which actually worked quite good during my stay. Breakfast was included and it was basically ok. The restaurant is located just beside the hotel and serves a selection of bread, jam, variety of scrambled egg, occasionally pancakes, cereals and some pastry. Overall it was ok. But once again the staff did not seemed to care much about the guests. Location is ok but walking back to the hotel at night seemed a little intimidating. There is three big parking lots surrounding the hotel and when night falls it attracts many unfortunate homeless people who decides to sleep there overnight. So the walk back to the hotel at night is not scary but for me it was troublesome. For my next stay in San Diego I will probably try another hotel as there is many hotels in the area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic- Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: brodie52
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic cheap and cheerful hotel within walking distance of the cruise ship terminal-this is it! Don't expect service of any kind-be prepared to put your own bags into the storage room when your room isn't ready upon arrival and retrieve them later. Front desk staff appear disinterested in the guests. Rooms come with free wire-less internet but it is so SLOW you may as well not have it at all. The included breakfast is basically eggs, toast, pancakes and cereal...again basic but acceptable. Rooms are clean, spacious and inoffensively decorated. The shower is excellent. Would we stay here again? Of course as long as prices are kept below $120 a night...Room tip: ask for a room that doesn't overlook the pool as this area can be noisy. You could really hear the noise all the way up to our third floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Strange layout but hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: Oddly designed hotel. To get to the bar or restaurant, you have to leave the hotel and walk down the street to another entrance. Also, you can't use the stairs in the hotel as they are kept locked and only opened in an emergency (or so we were told). So, when one of the two lifts is out of order, as was the situation when we were staying, there can be a long wait to get up to your room. Breakfast is free and is OK. Provided you are not too late there are enough tables for all. Room was OK but pillows were small and excessively springy. They weren't very nice at all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marie_Claude30
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a convention and real happy to stay here. Nice room on 7th floor with view of the Star of India and the bay. Easy to walk to the convention center. Good breakfast, near Little Italy and Gaslamp, free wifi. People at the front desk were real helpful. We enjoyed our stay. The noise of the train is not so bad when we close the door and use the climatisation. Free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: mom1950
Reviews.Content: I was well pleased with this hotel. It was located within walking distance to Little Italy and to the bay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and came with a fridge, microwave, free wi-fi, and room safe. The lighting in the room was excellent. So many hotels have dim lighting, but this one was bright . It was nice. A free breakfast is included and it was a full hot breakfast. Book early. It fills up fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price, good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDiva51
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a good hotel in a good location in San Diego - the fact that the hotel has its own parking garage adjacent to the hotel was a big plus, and one of the reasons we picked this hotel. Even if you got back to the hotel late in the evening, it was no problem finding parking in the garage. The rooms were decent and reasonably quiet, pretty standard for a Best Western. The free continental breakfast could use improvement, though - the quality of the food wasn't great, and the options were very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, have stayed in better places”
Reviews.Author: theslant
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok. It is a convenient location for walking to the bay and the maritime museum. Our reservation came with one complimentary breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, which was a nice bonus and allowed us to eat our fill. The room was clean and comfortable enough with an amazing view of the bay. The decor is dark and the building looks about a hundred years old. Our main complaint here was the housekeeping staff. They were extremely loud and seemed to be standing outside our door every morning screaming down the halls to one another. Having stayed in San Diego multiple times, I think there are many hotels that are a much better value with a little nicer look and feel to them where I know I have slept much better since people didn't stand right outside my door screaming at 7 am (I mean every morning we were there, for at least an hour and a half the screaming and banging occurred).

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: CheersTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in late August at this Best Western. It was overall a pretty good deal but it lacked any wow factors. The location was very good unless you want to be in the center of the Gaslamp District (if so, pick another hotel). Pros: (1) Transportation to the airport, (2) in the middle of everything, (3) friendly staff Cons: (1) The restaurant that served the breakfast was out of a lot of food items, plates, silverware, etc. The menu did not vary much from day to day and all of the traditionally tasty food items were only available for an additional charge. (2) Slow elevators!

Reviews.Title: “oh oh-but then just soo good!”
Reviews.Author: sofiabianchini
Reviews.Content: When first checking in.... it has been a NIGHTMARE! We had a very unpleasant experience and long waiting procedures. After that the staff was very caring and repaired the mistakes they made in the best way possible...and everything was just good, everyone was very helpful and at disposal, and the area (close to little Italy) was nice and not too busy. Room a little noisy, but very nice and beeing at the 9th floor the view of the bay was very good. I would definately go back again. Breakfast was outside the Hotel but just few steps and could have been just a little better. Overall very good!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: shortcakeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 2 nights here, I have not a bad word to say.. Checkin was fast and efficient, rates were great, location is perfect (5 min walk to Little Italy, 10-15 min walk to the heart of Gaslamp Quarter and 5 min walk to the water), breakfast simple but plentiful, rooms great size and clean which include a balcony and parking cheap at $10 per night..... If u call the hotel direct they will offer you a great rate.. I shopped around and reviewed heaps of hotels and I think I found a gem.. Don't get me wrong, it is nothing over the top but location, price and cleanliness all factor into this great review.. Wifi works fantasstic too... Only problem was I didn't stay long enough in SD as it is a wonderful City with amazing, clean, pretty and so much history and sight seeing to be done.. Do yourself a favour and allow at least 5 nights..

Reviews.Title: “a standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraL81
Reviews.Content: Best Western Bayside inn, was a standard best western. Not bad, but not really good. A little old, but in good condition. The good points are that it has a park (10$ per night), free wifi, it's near the airport and the seafront. The breakfast takes place in the hotel restaurant and it's good enough.

Reviews.Title: “downtown at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: BSNRN
Reviews.Content: From the time we were picked up at the airport to when we were dropped back off at the airport 5 days later, all staff were very friendly and very willing to help make our stay a pleasure. Our room was clean with a great view of the bay, which were enjoyed on the room’s balcony. The front desk walked us through setting up the Wi-Fi after we failed to make a connection The only downside to our stay was the very slow elevator and the restaurant could have longer hours for the late night arrivals.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during Comic Con weekend and it was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: the_explorer7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such a great location. My family and I stayed during Comic Con because it was only minutes away from the event. Boy was it a crazy weekend in San Diego. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Sometimes I get surprisingly pleased with the level of service and friendliness of Best Westerns. A+ to this hotel and the employees!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, we'll come back!”
Reviews.Author: bouncin_bichon
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Best Western Plus Bayside Inn. It was easy to find. Check-in went smooth. The beds were awesome! I hate hotel beds, but this one was one of the best. The bathrooms were great too, very up to date. I always had hot water! Coming from a house that lives off of a small water heater, it was soooooo nice to take a 20 minute HOT shower! We had a great view of the city, every few minutes an airplane would fly right by. No noise at all. The only noise that I heard was the trolly, but it stopped when we went to sleep. The only thing that could have been a problem was the elevator. They are updating their elevators, so only one is in use. We left and came back to the hotel when there wasn't many people there so we didn't have many issues. But I would assume that during check-in and check-out hours it'll be a little difficult to get to a higher room floor. So if you are going there soon, call and see if there elevator is still under matinee. If so ask if you can get a first floor room. It'll be great when both can be used! My one complaint is the parking, The parking garage was a very very tight fit. It was also $10 a day! If you do pay for parking make sure your little tag is visible, ours fell down and we got a ticket. They did have a complimentary breakfast. It was just okay. They had good potatoes, onions, and pastries. Otherwise it was just okay. The rooms have a pretty large mini fridge, so if you can find a grocery store I would stock up. Great stay. If we ever go back to San Diego we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfamincali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on a Saturday night as we were going to attend the Sicilian Festival on Sunday,,,the hotel is in a great location right in the heart of downtown. Parking was on premise for a $10 fee and continental breakfast for two was just okay. Free Wi-fi for guests worked good. Only one elevator and was slow, but was told they are adding another one. The room was clean and quiet. Overall the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jnjseattle
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. The shuttle to/from the airport was timely. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is well maintained. We easily walked to Balboa Park, Gaslamp, Petco Park, Seaport Village, USS Midway, Coronado Ferry and the trolley. Little Italy was just blocks away with great restaurants and a fabulous Saturday market. Old Town was about 2 trolley stops away. Breakfast was simple, but adequate. The elevator issue was only a problem about 3 times during our 7 night stay. There is some trolley/ship noise, but not a problem at night. The bay view from an upper floor room is beautiful. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “View from the top”
Reviews.Author: Rt66tbird
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed being on the 12th, top floor, for the views. Yes, the single semi operating elevator was a chore. Room was average and not totally clean. Desk and table tops were not all that clean in that there were sticky spills remaining. Connecting restaurant offered very nice evening meals at good prices. Breakfast in the same restaurant was average but expected per the usual expectations for BW. The always present tip jar. I do tip but do not care for the begging bowl. Does not seem classy. TV so, so. No Fox News. Bias? There is a plus for this hotel and that is the staff. Well staffed, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - take a cab from airport”
Reviews.Author: SteveEsteban
Reviews.Content: The place is nice and the location is awesome with great access to Little Italy and downtown. The room was clean with a noisy vent in the bathroom that shut down during sleeping hours. My main complaint is the airport shuttle takes forever, you are better off taking a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Wazari09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located e near all the main attractions, although the streets near by stay a little deserted at night. The room is big and comfortable and the staff is helpful. They have parking, but you have to pay US$10 per night, which is not bad. One of the elevators was being renovated, so we only had one working, which as bit annoying, since sometimes you had to wait more than expected. Nevetherless, it´s a minor temporary problem. The dowside for me was the breakfast. Although it´s included, it has very little options and it´s very poor. I expected more!

Reviews.Title: “The basics”
Reviews.Author: Kolbrich
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you don't plan on staying in a lot. One elevator was out of order which was a bit of a nuisance, and don't plan on sun bathing because the pool is surrounded by tall buildings. Other than that it was clean and efficient and the parking garage was very convenient albeit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_traveller_8
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our stay in this hotel. It is located in "downtown" San Diego, so you can do a lot of things by foot. We for example walked to gaslamp quarter, and little italy, for dinner. The best thing is they provide parking. (I thought this was for free, but alas they charged me extra for this on my final hotel bill :-() Staff was very friendly and helpfull when we arrived. We had a room with "city view" on one of the highest floors. The room was as you would expect from a BW. The beds were excellent! There is free wireless internet. The pool looked nice, but we did not use it. Included in the price is a breakfast in the restaurant next door. This is a very basic breakfast (there are for example also some hot items like eggs and potatoes), but it's a nice extra! If you are looking for a good hotel, for a reasonable price in downtown San Diego, this hotel would be a good option for you!

Reviews.Title: “too far from convention center”
Reviews.Author: luvlygal
Reviews.Content: i was uncomfortable the moment i walked in the door and a security guard was sitting next to the door. he was unfriendly and scared me because he said i was in a dangerous city and there have been issues in the part of town where the best western is located. this hotel is not where all the fun and action of san diego is and i was disappointed to be so isolated. also, i went to san diego to attend a conference at the convention center and was told the hotel was .5 miles from the convention center but it was so much further. i expected it to be an 8 minute walk but it was over 20 minutes and through a bad part of town. i was also told that there was a free shuttle to take me to the convention center every morning but this was not true as the shuttle was 4 blocks away. on top all that, i didn't sleep all night because the train was super loud. i checked out after 2 days and stayed with a friend instead of staying the 3 days that i paid for ahead of time. the hotel was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: rosebud018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during the week. We were not looking for a resort hotel, just something that we could sleep in and have a full day of sightseeing. First off this hotel is in an ideal location. Four blocks from the Star of India ship, a nice walk down beside the bay. We took the ferry across to Coronado one day, beatufiul and an easy walk from the hotel. The trolley was only two blocks from the hotel very easy access to get to old town or Balboa park. With complimentary breakfast and airport shuttle I feel this hotel is one of the better bargains in downtown. My only complaint would be the walls were very thin and could hear everything, also the patio door was drafty and could feel a breeze. Also the internet was down while we were there but they let us use the office computer, big help! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Stina76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Bayside from Fri, Feb 4th to Mon, Feb 7th. Let me start by saying how convenient the complimentary airport shuttle was. It was not more than a 10 min wait before the van was there and then a 10-15 min drive to the hotel. We got there around 11:30 a.m. and they let us check in early. We were in room 1405 on the top floor with a bay view room. The view was great, we could see the Star of India ship and the sunset in the evening. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location is perfect for everything we wanted to do. The trolley stop is only about 2 blocks away. We took the blue line to visit Old Town. The hotel is situated about 2 blocks from Little Italy, and a little farther away (10-12 blocks but still walkable) to the Gaslamp area. Those were all of the areas we wanted to go so it worked out great. Also, being so close to the bay, you can walk to the ferry and other site seeing tour boats. The breakfast was average I would say. It was nice having a few warm items to choose from (breakfast potatoes, pancakes one morning, oatmeal, eggs, grits) along with the usual continental breakfast items (muffins, toast, cereal.) Just to let you know, you can purchase sausage, bacon, or other items for an extra charge, although we never did. We got a rate of about $125 a night and I thought that was good for being in such a great location. I thought that the staff was great, they gave us directions several times and even extended our checkout time. I would stay here again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not as I expected...”
Reviews.Author: MizzEboo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed there to be in the downtown area for New Years Eve. As we were checking in service wasn't at it's best. To check in took about 15 minutes, as another guest had a complaint about parking an associate started raising her voice/"yelling" at her. There is a $10 fee for guest parking and not much avaiulability as guest were double parked, which frustrated us. Driving into the lot seemed like such a tight squeeze that would be hard to have some cars entering and exiting at the same time. After all the madness of checking in and parking our room was on the 6th floor so we had to take the elevator. They had two but one out of order, and still it managed to take "forever and a day". I was however happy with the room. Breakfast was great but the area was on the other side of the parking structure. Overall the stay was meant for us to sleep, and we did just that. This is NOT a get away, vacation type of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't choose to stay again...but met my needs...”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: The staff was a huge pain to deal with...and I had to deal with them about 5 times for a one night stay! I was charged for 2 nights when my reservation clearly said "1 night", I was given the wrong room, and then when we were finally given the correct room it was dirty! Once everything was straightened out, I had a nice view, was pretty close to several restaurants and only a short car ride away from Gaslamp. Overall, this hotel met my needs but I would never stay here again. There are PLENTY of hotels to choose from in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,very clean,but more of a short stop hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirsty201077
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the Bayside Inn The location was brilliant You are minutes away from Little Italy which is gorgeous Wine bars and nice restaurants.(they have a farmers market too on a Saturday) You can walk to the harbour which is an interesting half day and then up to seaport village An outdoor shopping centre. We got the trolley to old town San Diego not far at all This is a lovely square very Mexican well worth a visit. We also got the ferry across to Coronado twice this beach is gorgeous very cosmopolitan place loved it! The only reason I would say short stop is that the hotel has slightly more of a business feel rather than leisure due to the pool area being quite small no bar + not getting much sun but for a few days thats fine. The Amtrak rail noise is loud but soon solved by keeping the window shut and putting the air con on. We had a bayview room absolutley brilliant view ! So all in all I would reccomend for a short break

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel! Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: lisakellycdn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in San Diego. This hotel was wonderful, it was quiet, reasonably priced, clean and the staff were excellent. We weren't going to rent a car to drive to WAP and Seaworld (was going to take a tour bus) but the staff helped us to locate a good deal and advised us on places to eat, see and driving directions. When we left they organised our taxi, they also had incidentals provided free of charge-like toothbrushes, shavers etc. We had breakfast included in our meal and ate at the restaurant in the hotel, it was fine-both contintal and hot food that was freshly made. I went to use the internet kiosk and as it wasn't working was allowed to go into the office itself to email. Siliva and Hortio were wonderful as was Vera (I think) the other lady who worked there. When we left there were no hidden charges, local calls were free. All staff from housekeeping to office were great and were very friendly and my 6 yr old loved them. I also requested a bayview room and got one at no extra charge. This hotel was perfect for walking along the Esplanade and catching city transit. There is a small grocery store/pharmacy about 1 block away and it's easy walking to the train/tram stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and a great room”
Reviews.Author: CutesyBubblez
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying on the 14th (top) floor. We had a view of the water/ships, city, even planes landing. We loved the the conveniences and furniture. Great for a romantic city stay or business traveler. Parking was $10/day though.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: gusSouthGlos
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights by travel company. The room smelt unclean and had a distinct old cigarette smell too. The pillows reeked, obviously needed to be laundered and when I asked for the pillows to be changed, the same ones were returned having been put in the tumble dryer to "freshen up" !! Requested directions to the stairs as both lifts busy only to be told that access to the stairs was outside and I would need a key.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views of the harbor”
Reviews.Author: doglover123_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks on vacation. It was ok for the price but would choose something else if I visit San Diego again. The first room we were given was on the first floor, it smelled of mold and smoke and was so dark even with the lights on it looked like a scary movie. I asked to be moved because I couldn't sleep there....we were moved to a floor with a descent view of the city. Lots of noise from the city though. If you stay here request a room facing the harbor front and a room that is high up....you will get the best of what the hotel has to offer. I saw those rooms as housekeeping were cleaning them and had the doors left open! The hotel does have some renovated rooms and I would definately request one of those. While I was there the pool was not in operation. Close walk to the ocean front which was nice. Not many nice restaurants in the area and the food at the hotel itself isnt that great! Some staff were very helpful others were rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrit99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of a touring holiday on the west coast. After getting our bags at San Diego airport we headed to the information desk to find out the best way to get to our hotel, they very helpfully called to order the hotels free shuttle service. It arrived promptly and took us straight to the hotel. Check-in was simple and the staff friendly and helpful. Room was fairly basic but big and spotlessly clean. Breakfast is served at the Bayside Grill, just next door, and is a buffet style with cereal, pancakes, toast, muffins, coffee and juices. The hotel was really well placed in the city, near the sea and little italy. The only fault with this hotel is it's proximity to the Amtrak station and lines, each train toots it's horn really loudly as it comes in and out of the station. Not the fault of the hotel though obviously, just take some ear plugs if you're a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtogoanywhere
Reviews.Content: First the pros which out weigh the cons. 1) Clean, clean, clean. Even the pool area was spotless. 2) Recycle bin in bathroom 3) Great Wifi for free 4) Lots of restraunts within walking distance (little Italy). 5) San Diego Trolley 2 blocks away. 6) Ample parking for 10.00 nite. 7) Bed was extremely comfortably. 8) Bay within 3 minute walk. 9) Balcony that you can actually stand on and patio doors that open wide for ocean breezes. 10) Black out drapes for sleeping in. 11) Walking distance to Horton plaza/cruise ship terminal/seaport village. Now the cons...train noise that was easily shut out by closing patio doors to balcony or ear plugs (the plus side of this is that the train station is within walking distance). Free breakfast buffet was lacking especially if you got there after 9 am. Personally I would have given this a 5 star except that is says it is within walking distance of gas lamp area which I found was not.

Reviews.Title: “A True Find!”
Reviews.Author: luvsf
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on 7/23/10. Keep in mind that Comic Con was in San Diego that weekend so prices were jacked up accordingly! The BW Bayside Inn was the CHEAPEST rate in S.D. at $170.99 plus tax and $10 per night parking. Total came to $202.96 for a king bed, desk, free WiFi, loveseat, microwave & mini fridge. It is located 2 blocks from the bay also. Free breakfast is in the adjacent building, The Bayside Restaurant & Grill. Nice enough with white linen tablecloths and pleasant music and no confound news on the t.v. constantly! Selections were slim to say the least. Lukewarm scrambled eggs, oatmeal (?), gravy-----no meats! There the usual bagels, croissants and pastries (not very appetizing looking). We just had toast and cereal and yogurt, juice and coffee. Hey, it was included in the room rate! The hallways were spotless and so was our entire room. Not a lot of space on the bathroom sink area though the bathroom itself was HUGE because they had assigned us to a handicapped accessible room! Talk about a weird shower! It was not attached to the wall, but on a sliding rod and the stream of water barely got you wet! HORRIBLE SHOWER---the only thing bad about our room! The hotel was surprisingly quiet at night and the mattress and pillows were great. The hallways and rooms could use some new carpeting and the bathrooms could use some new thicker towels! That would be the only improvements I could think of. Considering all other decent hotels were booked due to Comic Con and the others wanted $289.00 & UP for one night, we considered $170.99 a bargain! The front desk staff is very accomodating and friendly, I might add!

Reviews.Title: “convience, close to Little Italy & Harbor Dr (3blocks down), Great location, Good price!”
Reviews.Author: lanacura
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk check in/out. Very very helpfull with calling in my confirmation on my reservation ahead before arrival, got what i need 2xqueens. Clean room & hotel. Comfortable beds. Wonderful deals on value room price. Great location, convience to restaurant & Harbor dr. Will stay again with great deals. Hightly recommended... small room, can't comparing with Mandalay Resort. Sink & toilet need service, called & got fix immediatly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: abdul100
Reviews.Content: Close to port, 20 min walk to the Gaslight area, clean, modern rooms, free Wi-Fi, secure car park, free buffet breakfast.. What else do you want? Only downside: we had booked ocean view room which was great except for the trains that cross the road about 500yds away and make a racket with their horns! The only problem is you cna hear them just about everywher in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay Except for the Cockroach and Surly Help”
Reviews.Author: c3isme
Reviews.Content: One night stay over the 4th of July to see the fireworks. View from the room was very good (top floor bay side). Fireworks did not disappoint. Best part of the experience beyond the fireworks...the pillows...just great...wish I could take them home with me. Worst part... the huge (tree inches long ...not counting the antennae) cockroach in the bathroom. As this room was on floor 14, had to wonder about what the lower floor rooms must experience. Next morning showed up for the free breakfast at 9:30AM and was told that they did not serve after 9:30AM except on Saturdays and Sundays...not holidays. This is NOT the world-class-customer-is-right attitude I expected from a Best Western property. It wasn't the reality of the situation it was the surly demeanor of the employee that was offensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a precruise stay.”
Reviews.Author: Manitobans
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the San Diego airport , we called the hotel for a shuttle and it came in about 15 minutes. It was a short ride to the hotel. We checked in, got our key and went up to our room. It had not been cleaned. Back down to the front desk we went only to be offered an inside facing room. We said no and were given a room with a street view. The room was very clean, had the king bed we had reserved, and had a small fridge and a microwave as well as coffee making supplies. There was a small balcony and the room was decorated with tasteful draperies and bed linens. The bathroom was again very clean with the usual soaps and shampoos. The towels were a little thin but did the job just fine. There is a parking lot attached but it was not too big. Wwe parked our rental one day at 3pm and ther were only 3 other spots available. The parking was $10 per day. The complimentary breakfast is served next door at the Elephant and Castle Pub. It offers an enhanced continental buffet with eggs and breakfast meats. We ate there one evening for dinner and I had a very good bowl of clam chowder and my husband had a tasty burger. A few minutes walk will take you to the harbour front. We had a nice meal at a restaurant overlooking the water there. The cruise terminal is located just down the street on the harbour. There are not a great many restaurants within walking distance but we ate at one across the street called Petrini's offering good Italian food. When cruise day came, we discovered several guests had prebooked the shuttle and as we only booked the evening before, we found our scheduled shuttle time would have gotten us to the ship too late for our needs.. We cancelled the shuttle and booked a cab instead. The next morning the hotel cancelled the cab for us and said they could take us to the cruise terminal at a good time for us as they had hired on an extra shuttle. We consider that to be excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, pity about the train”
Reviews.Author: Calgarysputnik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 year old daughter in March 2010. The hotel is well situated to take the trolley (Not stroller friendly) which we used to travel around San diego. It's only a few blocks from walking by the pier and little Italy. The people working there are extremely friendly and made our stay very pleasant. They also have shuttle service to and from the Airport. The breakfast is included and restaurant located 20 meters just down the street, it's not the best breakfast in the world but it's free and get's the day off to a good start. The major drawback of this hotel is it's location close to the sound from the regional trains constantly blowing the horn every 20 seconds when they approah Santa Fe station (About every 30 mins) and well past bedtime. The rooms have fridge and microwave which was very practical to heat up stuff with our little one and again all inclusive. The Best Western is certainly a better option then the Holiday Inn just down the street. I would recommend the hotel for the budget concious traveller but if your a light sleeper and can't wear ear plugs then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it...you can find 4 star hotels at comparable prices”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to my stay here because I had taken advantage of Best westerns price match guarantee on a great rate i found on a competitor website. Prior to arrival I asked if the room type could be switched to 2 double beds and I was told that there was an extra $20/night charge for having an extra person. I told the staff member i had originally booked for 1 adult and I thought the rate was for double occupancy, but was told that was not the case. After checking online I found that the rate for 1 or 2 adults is exactly the same, lies from front desk staff to get the room rate increased to a rate closer to their normal rates, so much for my great find on a competitor website. Rate only increases if there are more than 2 guests to the room. Second issue,upon arrival, there was a very long hair in the tub, i took pictures as evidence. I turned on the shower so that the hair would go down the drain, but all that happened was i saw how slowly water drained! I called front desk about the issue, but nothing was ever done! Third issue, prior to booking I was told that a free hot breakfast was provided for free. I specifically asked what items to expect since you usually get what you pay for. I was told eggs,potatoes,pancakes etc. Upon arrival eggs, oatmeal and biscuits were found in the hot food area, disappointing after having called to receive specifics. Fourth issue, was placed on second floor, and the high speed internet was more like SLOW speed internet. Filled out a survey and followed up with corporate and all I received was an email from the hotel manager with an apology. Figured at the very least they could refund the fee they added to the nightly rate, but not the case. Not very close to gaslamp, look into the W, Solamar, Se, or Omni. Ive found all those at under a $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: travelizsisters
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Best Western Bayside Inn and we would definitely stay here again. We chose this hotel for the great value + location. Little Italy and Harbor Drive are a few short blocks away. The America Plaza & Santa Fe trolley stops are in easy walking distance. We used the public transportation system exclusively on this trip and found stops close by and the system easy to navigate. Staff was very friendly and helpful in answering any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected with great service”
Reviews.Author: eruditetraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a one night layover in San Diego. Was very pleasantly surprised by this place. Called for shuttle service from the airport, took about 20 minutes which wasn’t bad, the driver was very professional and courteous. The evening staff checked me in quickly. There is a restaurant next door which provides free continental breakfast available with your room rate (you get a voucher on checkin). It is a quick walk to Little Italy so I was able to grab a late night bite to eat. The area seemed very safe and I was able to walk around at 1030 p.m. looking for food without any concern for safety. The room was large and clean. The room rate was reasonable $123 (that’s including tax, $109 without). Have stayed at hotels in hotel circle and the Marriott – Mission Valley but would plan on staying here again for return trips based on the room rate, cleanliness, helpfulness of staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imissmyomi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to our cruise. Upon landing at the airport, I called the hotel and they sent their shuttle within 15 minutes to pick us up. When we arrived, all our paperwork was ready. Staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean, the bed and pillows very comfortable, we had a view of the harbor from our balcony. As we arrived in the morning, we had most of the day to spend in San Diego. The harbor is within walking distance with maritime museums and restaurants. Little Italy was two blocks away and we were able to pick up the Old Town Trolley for a tour of major highlights in San Diego from there, the hotel was able to sell us the tickets. Breakfast was a very good selection of hot and cold items. Would definately recommend this hotel and would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ViviJeff
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers breakfest for free, the fares are good, is very close to the San Diego Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we Wanted”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandBruce
Reviews.Content: We wanted to see San Diego before went went on a Cruise,so we booked two nights. The staff were very friendly and recommended the step on step off Trolley Tour which we took the next day. Worth the fee. We did not arrive until 6 PM aftering travelling 15 hours. They picked us up at the airport. We ate right acros the street at an Italian restaurant, which was not verry busy but the food was really good and they serve half portions, which was pleanty for us. You can walk to the port,around 10 min. where we boarded the trolley, another 5mim to Seaport Village. The big Mall is also within walking distance as well as Little Italy. Great place to stay. Breakfast OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: ptero
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, 6 days Pros: Great location, reasonably good breakfast, reasonably clean Cons: Old towels (clean), old shower curtains (not-so-clean), hotel needs to be refurbished Problems: Reserved a Bayview room (for which they charge more) but the bathtub drain was not working properly - so ended up with 3 inches of water by the time I was done with my bath. Complained about it and was asked to change rooms to a regular room (not bayview) next day. Same problem!! Complained in the evening - but was not fixed. Complained next morning and it was finally fixed. On top of this, they charged me for the Bayview room for the entire stay, claiming that I booked through a third party, so they cannot change the reservation. The cleaning and restaurant staff were very helpful; the front desk - not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (for cruise, airport), excellent value, top service”
Reviews.Author: mahatinu
Reviews.Content: We had researched this place prior to arrival, and it duly lived up to expectations. Our cruise ended in San Diego, and we called the hotel at 9.00am asking if they could pick us up from the cruise ship terminal. The complimentary shuttle duly arrived about 10 minutes later, and drove us the short distance to the hotel. Although check-in time is officially 3.00pm, we were told our room was ready and were allowed to access the room (no extra charge). Nice big room on the 8th floor, with coffee maker, fridge, microwave, comfortable bed, good bathroom. We dumped our luggage, and then asked about the easiest way to get to San Diego zoo. The hotel staff explained that the Number 7 bus dropped you outside, for about $2, and it was only a 15 minute trip. So we took this option. Returned to hotel following an all day trip to the Zoo, and worked out how to use the hotel's free internet facility. In the morning, we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast - usual selection of tea/coffee, juice, cereals, breads, muffins etc. Then took advantage of the complimentary airport shuttle. All in all, we thought the hotel met all of our needs, for a superb low price (we booked via Travelocity).

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DocGJ
Reviews.Content: Only visited for a few days for a conference in San Diego but had a really nice stay. Nice big room with air conditioning huge comfy bed clean bathroom, helpful front desk - clearly used to having conference delegates about - provided me with the local map and timetable for the conference centre bus (which picks up just across the street) as soon as I arrived. Little restaurant on the corner does a descent self service breakfast. Couldnt fault it really for my needs

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gksra42105
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!! We only stayed 1 night because we came for a day trip from Redondo Beach where we were staying at the Crowne Plaza. We chose this hotel because it was inexpensive and spur of the moment and our Redondo Beach hotel was paid for through the week, so we were budgeted on our San Diego stay. We had no difficulty finding this hotel and even though its not a large hotel, we found it to be very well kept and the staff was very nice!! We actually preferred this hotel to the Crowne Plaza we were staying at the rest of our vacation! If we ever travel back to San Diego, this will be the hotel we stay at!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcanderson
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great..Friendly check in and out..Great breakfast (hot cereal, eggs, toast ++). Close to the Midway and Bay...Not really close to Gaslamp..but walkable. Great Views from top floors. Smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: baseballmomken10
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the USS Midway, easy trolley ride to Petco Park and Gas Lamp Quarter, and short bus ride to the Zoo, we sure enjoyed our 3-day stay here. Free shuttle to the airport and complimentary breakfast also made it easier on our budget! The staff was friendly and Shiela was especially helpful in showing us how to navigate around town. (if you have little ones, you might want to rent a car) Rooms clean and comfortable - we had a nice view of the ocean and the train did not keep us awake. Rite Aid and a bank across the street, too. All in all - a great deal and a fun vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great if slightly noisy location”
Reviews.Author: CamUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for sightseeing as it's a short walk from the bayside and next to Little Italy. Better because we got a bayside view, may not be so good if you don't. it was very noisy with trams, trains and boats going past all the time. Comfy beds and spacious room but the shower temparature was a bit dodgy! Breakfast was appalling, don't bother with this at all. Had to clean our own table and they ran out of food. Reception staff were really good and provided corkscrews on demand! Parking was good, secure and good value. Great restaurants in Little Italy only 5 minutes walk away and a beautiful French Cafe across the road on India Street for Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Go Some Place Else!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: WOW, where do I start? Ok, I was a late check in. The guy says he has one room left, so I hurry over there. At the counter I hear him say that to another customer on the phone, hummmm. The card key wouldn't work on my door, the security guard downstairs asked as I approached "Let me guess, your key dosen't work" Good guess! Must happen allot! I was on the 14th floor with luggage so this was a pain in the butt to cart my stuff back to the elevevator (no hotel phone in site) and back downstairs. The air did not work, it was a fan type musty smelly air that came out of the air contioner vent on the wall, no matter how low you tried to lower it, the air stayed at an awful sticky smelly 75. It must of been set by the hotel to not go lower. When it is humid in San Diego you want real air conditioning not this fan stuff. I also heard this God awful train and horn as I was checking in and asked the desk clerk if you heard that all night long he stated "not again untill 5 am or so" This was at 11pm when I asked. Well it happened every hour on the hour. He lied. Just as he lied to get me in there by saying only one room was left. I had a job interview the next morning and I barely slept at all. I was so pissed in the morning. Bums were sleeping on the sidewalks outside, no one asked them to move. I felt very uneasy about it. There are far better hotels in Sand Diego and this one cost me $150.00 which is no steal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinehart
Reviews.Content: Bayside is a good hotel, not fancy but has all you want. Close to Little Italy and the train system. Only downside was the sub standard breakfast provided. Parking costs $10 day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, considerably quiet and good location”
Reviews.Author: business_trav77
Reviews.Content: Some colleagues and I stayed at the Best Western Bayside Inn for a week in April 2009, attending a conference which mainly took place at the Convention Center and its surrounding hotels. Besides visiting the conference, we wanted to do some sightseeing and shopping. For this purpose, the hotel was just perfect. It is located just a few steps from the bay promenade, along which one could walk either to the convention center wihtin 20mins or so, and also into the city (the shorter way to the city and shopping areas such as Horton Plaza is straight through the city and does not even take 10mins). Check-Inn upon arrival was fast and friendly. Not over-friendly as some might know from 4- or 5-star hotels...but on the other hand, I did not want to become friends with the receptionists ;-) and they were nice enough to make us feel fine. The room (and we "only" had a standard room) was spacious with two huge queen beds and a lovely view to the Star of India sailship. Very clean, nice bathtub with shower included, which had a good water pressure. We also appreciated the coffee machine in the room, which helped especially during the first two days when we were still in a jet-lag. ;-) The wireless internet was sometimes a bit slow and my colleague was kicked out the net a few times, but on the other hand, it is free (try to get free internet throughout european hotels...good luck!) and overall worked good enough to check e-mails and do things such as skype. Some people mentioned the trains blowing their horns all night...well, yes, you can hear them once in a while, but we thought that the sound-proof windows did a good job and both had a decent sleep all week. What might be more of a problem if you have a light sleep or get disturbed easily is a room on one of the lower floors facing the pool. Another colleague was on the 3rd floor and said he could hear the pool generator (or whatever it was) quite clearly. To have breakfast, you have to walk out the hotel a few metres to the left and step into the adjoining restaurant. Not a big problem in sunny and warm April. Breakfast itself was ok...as always in the USA, way too sweet. ;-) But with choices of bread and scrumbled eggs, butter, jelly and several kinds of cereals, two or three kinds of juice, coffee (even decaf) and some (for our taste rather disgusting) kinds of oatmeal or porridge. Oh and of course pancakes and maple syrup. So overall and since it was included in the price, that was fine and enough to have a good start into the day. The hotel, by the way, is also just a block or so from Little Italy where you can find a lot of options to have a nice evening in a good and affordable restaurant. All in all, the rate we got was excellent (149,-$ plus tax), the hotel nicely situated, clean, spacious and friendly, and I would not hesitate staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Unuseable Internet Access.”
Reviews.Author: MontanaVoyager
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the Bayside Inn for three nights on business. The hotel was very nice and well located close to the convention center. My onlly complaint is that the "free" internet access was so slow that it was unuseable. I gave up and went elsewhere to connect. This is a serious problem when I am traveling on business. I would not stay at the Bayside again due to this problem.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a good experience”
Reviews.Author: RosieRed19
Reviews.Content: We were coming off a 9 day cruise and have some time to see San Diego. What a good city it is, we will plan to spend more time there next visit. We were Very pleased with this hotel choice, it's very close to the dockside, close to tourist attractions, close to the Italian section and very good restaurants. On vacation we are looking for value, cleanliness, amenities & safety, we don't usually spend much time in the room, This BW met our needs. There is a good little outdoor pool & hot tub, in the morning we had a decent breakfast before starting on our way, there is parking on site for a reasonable fee. We found the room to be comfortable, clean and quiet from any city noise. There was a brief loud disturbance outside our door in the middle of the night but the day staff denied any knowledge of what had occured. We never felt threatend by this disturbance. We weren't out after 9:00 pm so we are unable to comment on area safety but it seemed just fine during the day and early evening. One fun thing we did during the day was rent the 2- seater GPS guided go-cart like vehicle. We had seen them in San Francisco and the operator commented to us how much fun they were. We equally enjoyed the experience on the 2 hr tour overview of city. Not enough time to do Balboa Park but we saw enough that we know we want to come back to this city. The Midway is a must tour, pland to spend some time there, we were rushed. Corondo is an easy drive and a worthwhile trip. La Jolla is also pretty and we would have like more time in this area,.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like at all”
Reviews.Author: paulcartman
Reviews.Content: Even before I got to the room I was not happy. Did not like the fact that you had to walk 5 floors from parking your car to get to the lobby. Customer service at the front desk was slack & could do with a bit more training, The room it self was its average size, View was great, But during the night the train passing is very unpleasant. Bath towels were dirty & had holes in them. Bed was very comfortable. The internet connection was very slow and having only one public computer with a printer that does not print out clearly was pointless.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tarynsmum
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Got a large room with a lovely view of the bay. Very reasonably priced and good buffet breakfast included in the restaurant. From the Bayside Inn you can walk to the Gaslamp Quarter, Trolley Terminal, Little Italy and for a good walk down to the Fishing Village. Also, they were voted by our family "comfiest beds" that we slept in our 3 weeks in the U.S.!!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: comlab
Reviews.Content: We liked the Best Western Bayside in becaus of the great location near Gaslamp Quarter. It was the first time we were in San Diege and for that the Byside in was okay. The price is was a bit high. We stayed 2 nights at the Best Western under Week. The room was Best Western standard, clean and normal in size. We got a king bed room in 9th floor, and the view to bay was fantastic. For short visiting of San Diege we can recommend this Hotel. Parking was 10$ a day.

Reviews.Title: “Bayside Inn is a good base for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: The Bayside was a good, relatively affordable ($134/nt. AAA) place to stay in Downtown San Diego on a summer weekend--high season. It's located at the border between the financial district of downtown and the lively residential/restaurant area of Little Italy. As previous reviewers have pointed out, the hotel is within blocks of the Amtrak/Coaster station and the Trolley, as well as the main bus spine on Broadway. Since I was staying without a car access to all this transit--as well as the many places I could walk to--was important. Some previous reviewers commented that there were a lot of homeless people around. Maybe I'm just habituated to it, but it didn't seem like a lot to me--maybe a couple on each walk near the hotel. There were areas of the Downtown, particularly around City College, that seemed to me to have a much stronger presence of street people. I disliked the fact that in the downtown direction there weren't many people of any kind around on the weekend, and that there were an awful lot of parking lots to walk by (hopefully a few more highrise condos will get built and get rid of some parking lots!). I was initially put into a low floor (4th) smoking room despite asking for a high floor non-smoking room. The desk folks said they were completely booked Friday night, but at my request on Saturday moved me to a non-smoking room on the 11th floor. Well done. The breakfast seemed pretty hopeless, like so many hotel breakfasts are. There are a lot of more interesting places to eat in San Diego. You get either a city view or a bayside view from any room, since the hotel is built with two lines of rooms on either side of a double loaded corridor. It makes for an ugly building outside but good views, though on the west side you've got to get over the parking structure. There were a lot of young people staying there--as well as foreign tourists--but they seeemed to quiet down late at night. I closed the door to my balcony--the room's "window"-- to cut down noise late at night. Contrary to what's been said, there is a pause in train service in the middle of the night, but only from about 1 a.m. to 6 a.m. The room's decor was fine, but not particularly notable. I appreciated the absence of a minibar. The bathtub could have been a bit longer. I also appreciated the public access computer in the lobby, though it seemed to be in constant use--usually one had to wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I stayed here the weekend of the US Open at Torrey Pines. All the hotels in San Diego were jacking thier prices so I felt I got a pretty good deal here, and from what I've seen the price to be when it isn't a busy weekend this hotel would be quite a bargain. It's two blocks from Little Italy which has many restaraunts and a few bars. The Embarcadero(Harbor and Dining) is also only two blocks away. We had no trouble walking to the Gaslamp district(main nightlife entertainment and dining spot) and Petco Park, but travlers who have trouble walking might want to take a cab. The hotel is also very close to train stations and the airport. I was fairly impressed by our room. It seemed to be renovated in the last year or two. Carpet wasn't worn or tired looking. Beds were extremely fluffy and comfortable and had three pillows of varying softness so you could choose your favorite. Rooms are equipped with a microwave and mid-sized fridge(empty, no mini bar). The room was average size. The bathroom was standard with no frills. All rooms come with a balcony(I believe). The lobby was clean and the staff helpful. Security gaurd watched the front door late night. We didn't have time to sample the free breakfast or the have time to go the the pool. Parking is a little cramped but it's only ten dollars a day and getting a spot was never a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - but way too much noise at night”
Reviews.Author: Aerochik
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this room as part of our Park and Sail for a cruise. The room itself was very nice, and the location was good as far as getting around. It was also great that it offered a free shuttle to the cruise ship terminal, as well as parking for our vehicle while we were on the cruise. The continental breakfast buffet was average - had eggs, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, fresh fruit and cereal, with a variety of drinks to go with it. The downsides to this hotel were that there were a lot of transients around the area - as a female, I didn't feel safe leaving the room and going to my vehicle in the parking lot alone. Also, it is located one block from the train station......so, we heard the trains coming in and blowing their whistles ALL NIGHT LONG!!!!!!!!!! Also heard several sirens throughout the night. Despite the room being nice and the staff being friendly, we did not get much sleep because of the trains and sirens!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Some Respects; Mediocre to Downright Bad in Others!”
Reviews.Author: MizKitty007
Reviews.Content: After some of the mixed reviews here, I still took a chance on the Best Western Bayside Inn because of the price and its proximity to the American Society for Training & Development's International Convention & Expo. Some items were good, whereas others could stand moderate to major improvement. The front desk crew on the evening of June 1 provided excellent service. One of the ladies even cheerfully changed my dollar bills into quarters for the soda machine, which wouldn't accept bills from anyone that night. Room 509, to which I was assigned, was immaculate and reflected the facility's recent refurbishment. Now for my issues: • The slower-than-average bathtub drain even while the shower ran—Thankfully, the back of the tub had a subtle slope, enabling me to shower from there without having my feet touching undrained water!
