(When I checked out, I mentioned this to the manager on duty, who immediately called for maintenance.) • The restaurant serving breakfast—Even though the meal was a hot and cold buffet, the food presentation was dreary. The toaster lever needs to be manually raised after a few minutes of bread-browning. All I had was the Denver scramble, the single piece of toast, and OJ; the rest was downright unappetizing. (I had to fetch the spread [hard to tell if it was butter or margarine] from another table). This was one occasion where I was glad I brought in some groceries from Trader Joe's the night before! • The parking—I NEVER thought I'd encounter any hotel parking structure in the continental U.S. that would outsqueeze most in Waikiki for both width and backing space...and I'm afraid I found it in San Diego at the Best Western Bayside! One literally needs to do either of the following if one plans to driving to the Bayside. The first option is to drive a Toyota Corolla, a Honda Civic, or a shorter/narrower vehicle. The second option is to come in a car that has a disabled person's placard or license plate. This entitles the driver to park on the structure's ground level, where the designated spaces actually allow for a large pick-up or SUV. Moreover, one needs to be prepared to walk up and down stairs if parked on the second or higher level. There is no elevator. Neither is the ground-level door to the stairwell locked from the outside. Although the neighborhood is fairly safe (it borders on Little Italy), management should still make that door accessible only by room keycard, or work with the undisputed kings of downtown San Diego parking—ACE—for a larger and safer lot/structure!

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: bobhobard
Reviews.Content: Horrible stay. Here for big medical conference. Dirty, noisy, and poor service all around turned what could have been a nice stay into a nightmare. To make matters worse, unbelievably bad experience in the on-site restaurant. No customers here, and there is a good reason why. After waiting an hour for a burger, I asked the waiter how much longer it would take for my food to arrive. His response-"if you want to leave, leave" Provocative attitude prompted me to complain to the manager, who instead of apologizing, tried to justify this moron's behavior. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: insomniac06
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at San Diego airport we had no idea how to get to the hotel-we telephoned the hotel and we were told to get a taxi and to make sure to get a receipt for the journey. When checking in, they asked for our taxi receipt and they refunded the cost! Pretty nice gesture:-) We were impressed with our room. Clean, tidy, large and with a balcony overlooking the bay. The view really did it for me and adds loads of bonus points to this hotel. Keep in mind though that there is a lot of construction going on infront of the hotel which is almost certainly going to block the views in the future! To be honest, I didn't really like the area of the hotel. We decided to go for dinner at around 7.30pm and couldn't find anywhere open around the immediate area! There seemed to be quite a few restaurants but they were all closed. This seemed strange to me at this time on a Friday night. Also, there seemed to be quite a lot of homeless people nearby but we never felt threatened by them. Breakfast was included in our rate-it was okay. Nothing special but it did the job. The location of the hotel was quite convenient to the trolley station and bus stops-both were around a 5/10minute walk. This made it quite easy to get to attractions such as SeaWorld and the zoo. If I returned to San Diego, I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again, although I might chose somewhere with a more vibrant location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EzzaEm
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends and I stayed here for four nights. During this period we went to sea world, the wild animal park, tijuana and the san diego zoo. We found that the staff at the front desk were very helpful in giving us directions and information about public transport. They also confirmed our flight out of LAX for us. We found the rooms were a little bit small for the three of us. Too small that a roll-away bed couldn't have been put into the room. The microwave and the fridge came in really handy in storing food for dinner as we didn't feel safe to walk around the area at night. The shower was really weird to use, but once you get the hang of it, it was pretty good. The complimentry breakfast at the hotels restaurant next door was very good. It contained some hot and cold items as well as fruit. The hotels complimentry shuttle service took us to the Amtrak station. The driver was really nice and helpful. The train station isn't that far away from the hotel, but it was easier than lugging our stuff for two blocks. There is free internet access on one computer located in the lobby. We found that hardly anyone was using it. This was a very good feature to have. The hotel is pretty close to a large shopping mall, a supermarket, trolley and bus stations, train station and the local prison. The area at night had quite a few homeless people around. Im sure that they are quite harmless, however as a group of three girls at the age of 21, we felt safer to stay inside after dark. All in all, we quite liked this hotel. It was fairly close to everything and the free internet access and the complimentry breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Draft from around sliding window, gas leak smell, construction ...”
Reviews.Author: Forevermemories
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the free shuttle from the airport and to the cruise terminal. The shuttle driver was excellent. The front desk staff indifferent, non-informative, less than friendly. It was mid-December so there was a cold wind from the bay. The sliding window had extreme drafts and wind from all around its perimeter. There is major construction going on and is probably much needed. I wouldn't have put any pressure on this window because It would probably fall out of the structure. We put pillow along the floor edge to try to block the wind. When we commented on the strong gas leak smell, the front desk said it was nothing to worry about. Every time we came indoors to the hotel, we could detect the odor of gas. The location is convenient. The trains stop whistling around 11:30 or midnight and don't resume before 7am. We didn't find them to be a problem. Would I stay there again? No. Not worth the price, it is just too run-down.

Reviews.Title: “great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Va4luvrs
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised on how nice of a hotel this was. We only stayed one night during our honeymoon trip to S. California, before moving onto Coronado. The hotel is not much to look at from the exterior, but the interior was clean and well kept. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were the most comfortable that I have ever slept in. The hotel is in a great location at a great price. We were given a bay view without paying more. The view of the bay is limited but pleasant. The view will probably disappear within a year do to all the construction that is happening between the hotel and the bay. Would definately stay here again even when the view is gone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base To Explore The City”
Reviews.Author: igm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western between 2nd and 5th September 2007. Hotel was basic but exactly what we were looking for - somewhere to base ourselves to enable us to explore the city. The hotel was clean and in a great location (a 5 minute walk from the Little Italy and Gaslamp and a 30 minute walk from Balboa Park - not something to undertake in the midday sun though........oops!!!!). It has a swimming pool and jacuzzi which were nice at the end of the day and it offered free internet access which proved really useful. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the view from our window looked out across the bay, with great sunsets through the sails of the Star Of India ship moored in the harbour. The free breakfast wasn't great (offered at restaurant next door), but that didn't bother us in the slightest. Overall - nothing spectacular, but all that we needed as a base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “No problem. I'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: whelks
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay at the hotel was absolutely fine. I'd stay there again and I would have no problem in recommending it to friends and family. On the positive side the room was clean, tidy and well maintained. It was a 6th floor room so had an interesting view of various big buildings from the balcony. My son also enjoyed watching the planes flying quite low as they approached the airport. The pool and hot tub were welcome entertainment too. Staff were pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable (at least in answering the question of how to get to the zoo). Parking was $7 per night. On the negative side the complimentary breakfast was ok, but not great. Cereals: cornflakes, raisin (sugared) bran, fruit loops (I missed my Shredded Wheat and porridge), bread for toasting (though I missed my Marmite), muffins, pastries (a little stale at times), scrambled egg, orange juice and coffee (typical American - i.e. not good). That all sounds fine and I suppose it was really, but the polysyrene plates and cups along with the plastic cutlery took it all down a couple of levels. The only other negative point was a very unpleasant smell (like stale sweat) in our corridor at certain times of the day. It wasn't present in the lift, the lobby or the bedroom, just the corridor. As I said at the outset though, I would have no problem staying here again and would be happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sammy0623
Reviews.Content: The room had a funny smell to it. Fridge was kept off "to preserve our natural resources" which was annoying to have to wait for it to get cold. Elevators and hallway had no AC, and room AC was one extreme or the other-freezing or way too warm. Bathroom was nice sized. and our view wasnt too bad, looking out to the city. Receive free continental breakfast, which goes til 11/12 weekdays/weekends. However, that was about the only good part of it. Food didn't even look all that appetizing, and is served in hotel restaurant, although we didn't receive any service from the staff. Signs are up saying "no food to-go," along with a jar for "TISP" (not a typo lol). If you're eating the food, stick with teh fruit an cereal. The hotel only charges $7/'night parking, but it's probably because of the tight spaces in the weird garage. All of the spaces are very tight, even with our compact car. Also, garage has a weird layout, requiring you to take the drive ramps to get to the stairs. Staff was friendly and helpful, but they couldn't makeup for the crappy room. TV was fuzzy, with bad sound quality. Location is good, close to Little Italy, near Gaslamp Quarter, zoo, museums, and Coronado Island.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Soundwave
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed one night at the Bayside Best Western in downtown San Diego. We had a clean room and it is only a 5 - 10 minute walk to Seaport Village and downtown / Gaslamp District. ( women might not like walking alone at night, since the streets are kinda deserted ) Check out the Gaslamp District on a Friday night after a Padres game, it is really happening! You see young people clubbing and everyone generally having a good time. The vibe blew me away! Since we had just spent a few days in LA checking the sights, I was dog-tired. I had a good night's sleep on a very comfortable bed. You can also have basic breakfast at a discount at the restaurant right next to the hotel. Not too bad. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: caligirl111
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel! My father in law booked us into it, I normally do not stay at Best Westerns due to poor experiences in the past. The hotel is located 3 blocks from the harbor and 3 blocks from Little Italy. It was clean, rooms were spacious and the staff was very courteous and helpful. The pool and spa areas were small but well kept. It is situated near a train station but we were not bothered by the sound at all. Some people had complained in the past about airplane noise, we did not hear a single plane.The neighborhood has many residences and was overall quiet and seem to be safe. They offer a free buffet breakfast that is simple but if you like to eat a light breakfast, perfect. It included scrambled eggs, fruit, muffins, pastry, cereal, milk, coffee and tea. I would stay here again, as the price was very good for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: burnttimber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayside Inn the second week of July. We couldn't have found a better hotel for its location, price and amenities. Our room had a very large, comfortable bed and good view of downtown San Diego. We were within walking distance of the port/ships and enjoyed walking to Little Italy which had an inviting atmosphere and great food. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If we come back to San Diego again, we will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the rate we got”
Reviews.Author: WageniSasa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights while vacationing in San Diego. The hotel is conveniently located near the Airport (<2miles), Gaslamp Q, harbor, Amtrack, trolley, Hwy 5, Balboa Park and Zoo. The aircraft approach the runway a block from the hotel, but the noise was not intrusive. However, the hotel is in a noisey location - car alams going off, police/ambulance sirens, train horns, construction dump trucks - so you are likely to be woken up early in the morning. The room is standard BW with a microwave and fairly large refrigerator. There are several 7-11 stores nearby as well as a Rite Aid to stock up on water, snacks, etc. "Its a grind" coffee shop is a couple of blocks away, which serves excellent coffee. "Extraodinary Desserts" is also very close by and serves exquisite desserts. We walked to Gaslamp Q for dinner everyday. There are homeless people around, but we did not feel unsafe. You have to leave the hotel to get to the Breakfast room (which seems to double as a diner) but is on the same block. Breakfast is included in the rate, and is fairly decent, but service can be slow. You get cereal and toast, and for $3.50, two eggs and cut fruit - a relative bargain. The hotel was full, but we could always get a table. For those with a car, parking is $7 per day. We got a great rate (below $100 with parking), which was good value for us. Not sure if we would have stayed here if we had to pay the normal rate

Reviews.Title: “Good value for people on a budget downtown”
Reviews.Author: jeanki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a convention in downtown San Diego and found it a solid value. It certainly isn't a luxurious large scale hotel like the ones near the convention center, but it suffices for downtown convenience. The decor is somewhat outdated as the building appears to be from the early 80s, and the rooms tend to be somewhat shaded and dark as there is a neighboring bank building attached and blocking sunlight. There is still a nice bayview on one side, although as another review mentioned, there is a condo site that will eventually block the view. (So far there is no construction going up as yet.) They were nice enough to give us a bayview room even though we had not requested it. The rooms are a standard size, clean, and the queen size beds were above average IMO for comfiness thanks to a nice mattress pad. The microwave and fridge are convenient, and the clean if non luxurious bathroom has a hairdryer and coffeemaker. Water pressure was weak though for the shower. The location is very good, only a block from the nicest Rite Aid I have ever seen on Kettner and India St, and only a block and a half from the trolley stop that goes to the Gaslamp District (which is also walkable, but a long walk.) The area is safe and clean and right near good eats in Little Italy, and very close to the airport. The train line/trolley line passes next to the bay a couple blocks away and is somewhat noisy, but not enough to wake me from sleep. It might bother very light sleepers though. (It seems the noise is not as bad as with other similar budget hotels like Hampton Inn that are right next to the train line.) The parking is convenient and only $7 a night in a small unattended garage attached to the hotel, so you can come and go as you please. I found plenty of spaces available when I was there, so I didn't have the issues that others have noted finding a space. I didn't find the garage scary or weird either, it was open air and you could just walk down the ramps directly and roll bags along it because it was small.(there is no elevator) A compact car is easier to park given the size of the spaces. The included breakfast coupon is for a continental breakfast at an attached restaurant with sit down service, so you still have to pay tip. There is also a full menu so you can have a more substantial breakfast if you want, and the food was okay. Overall, this is a good value, full service hotel with a convenient downtown location. Staff were all pleasant and cordial. They made a small error with my hotel bill, but had already corrected it themselves by the time I called about it. Make sure to request a nonsmoking room when you reserve, as the hotel does still have smoking rooms too. No frills, but no glaring holes either.

Reviews.Title: “The NOT SO Best Western”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two days from 4/17-4/19 as part of a week long vacation to Southern California.I had read reviews on this site and went into it unsure of what to expect. We got to the hotel around noon and asked if we could check-in.Our room was ready so they allowed us to.We had a room on the second floor,with a great view of the street and the construction equipment.The room itself was alright. It had two semi-comfy beds,an older TV with an old channel changer that barely worked.The tub had a rust stain in it,and had a constant drip coming out of it.The bathroom was dark as the one of the neon lights was partially burned out.We were woken up at 5:30Am and 6:30Am because the construction equipment outside our window was being moved. The jacuzzi was hot,which was perfect,and all the jets,except maybe one were working(other reviews said they weren't.),however the new bank building that is attached to the hotel is so fall it blocks most of the sun from the pool area.The internet service in the lobby is junk.It is $12 for one hour,so i couldn't turn it down,but it was so slow it took forever for the pages to load. It also didn't recognize or wouldn't allow me access to commonly used websites and got messages about the page may be pornographic,even though they were not. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant wasn't that great,and the two old elevators had an odd smell,like an oil burner to them.Room service was not done cleaning our room by 2:30 the first day,which was a little bit sad considering it wasn't that big of a hotel,nor did it seem nearly full. The price is great,and by no means is this the worst hotel in the world.Just in downtown San Diego it's either cheaper hotels that have their issues,such as this one and the Holiday inn on the Bay,or really nice,expensive hotels like the W or Sheraton.There doesn't appear to be a median hotel. The hotel did have its positives,but it seemed(at least to me)to have more negatives. Would I stay there again?Maybe,but i doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisLovesthesun
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Best Western Bayside March 25-30 for Spring Break. The hotel was in a great location, perfect for people who didn't have a car there, like us. They have a free "shuttle" to and from the airport- more like a minivan with a crazy driver!! All you have to do is call the hotel once you have picked up your bags at the airport and they come in 10 minutes or so. The hotel is pretty standard issue hotel chain quality, although the furniture was fairly new. The room itself was HUGE- we had a king size bed, a couch, coffee table, table w/ 2 chairs, a desk, and a chair w/ ottoman. Plus the room has a mini-fridge and microwave that came in handy for leftovers! We requested an upper floor, per other tripadvisor suggestions, and ended up on the 12th floor so we were all most at the top (14 floors total- expect 14 is really the 13th- stupid superstitions!) We did not pay for the bay view, but our view of the city was great. The balcony is super small, but we liked being able to leave our door open and get fresh air. There is construction surrounding the hotel, and within a short period of time, there will no longer be any bay view rooms. The price of the hotel is reasonable, especially compared to other downtown hotels. We were only 3 blocks from the bay, walking distance to the USS Midway Museum, Seaport Village, and the Gaslamp Quarter. We did not use the hotel pool- it was kind of chilly, but I can tell you that it is not the kind of pool you relax by all day. This is definitely a city hotel! There is a "free" breakfast, but you have to go to the Bayside Cafe, which is attached to the hotel, and be seated. You can either get cereal (hot or cold) w/ toast & coffee/tea, or a bakery item (bagel, danish) with juice or coffee/tea. For a small fee you can add on eggs and fruit- we did it one day & it's a lot of food!! Only complaint is that you have to wait for food, and we were eager to get out of there and start the day. The hotel is just blocks from the Cruise Ship Terminal, and the ferry to Coronado Island. We also took advantage of the public Trolley system, which is just a few blocks from the hotel. If you go, visit Karl Strauss Brewery- a block from the hotel, and home of a well-known and enjoyed beer in the San Diego area- good food too!! Not far from the hotel is the Kansas City Barbeque- famous for it's part in Top Gun- Stop by and eat there! The food is great, and it hasn't changed since Tom Cruise was there in 1985!! We also took advice from fellow tripadvisor's and went to Rite Aide to stock up on drinks & that we kept in the room. Overall San Diego is a wonderful city, and this is a great place to stay and see all the sights. We went to the USS Midway Museum, the Zoo, Sea World, Sea Port Village, Old Town San Diego, Coronado Island, etc. It's a great city to see, and the weather is PERFECT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Livitup46
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I spent four nights at the BW Bayside Inn last week. The location is ideal for walking the city. Our room was clean and comfortable & we had a lovely harbor view (9th floor, bay view) from our balcony. The front desk staff were very helpful and accomodating. The shuttle to & from the airport was an added bonus (note the shuttle doesn't operate until 7 a.m.). The jets in the hot tub weren't operating properly & the elevators were a bit slow (unsure if both were working all of the time) but all in all, we were most pleased & would return. The free breakfast is beverage & muffin, but you can add eggs & fruit for $3.50. An easy walk to Little Italy, the harbor, trolley stop & Santa Fe Depot. A bit further (but definitely manageable) to Seaport Village & the Gaslamp. If you're looking for a day trip, we recommend a coaster train to Carlsbad Village ($11 rt). It was nice to get out of town & the trip was very scenic. Carlsbad was great for shopping & the beach was uncrowded. Many nice restaurants as well. All in all, it was an excellent trip & for the money, the Bayside Inn was great.

Reviews.Title: “clean and ok for the price, but VERY NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: bianca66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last night, actually, April 3, 2007, a Tuesday night. I had booked thru AAA and failed to specifically request a non-smoking room. That was my fault. The reservation was actually for a city view, but we got a harbor view instead (not complaining) and that kinda made up for being on the smoking floor. We were also just staying for one night before we went to the airport, so smelling the smoke from room next door was tolerable. Pros - 1. The harbor view really is very nice, and the Star of India (about three blocks away, I think) is not blocked at all by other buildings. We arrived just before sunset and it was beautiful setting over the harbor. 2. It is less than a 5 minute drive to the airport. 3. It is walking distance to the harbor area and Little Italy. 4. The parking was 7.00/night. From what I've read, this is fairly reasonable for downtown. And it's right next door. 5. I thought the breakfast at the Bayside Grill next door was just fine, with the vouchers. Coffee was only listed with our option of cereal/milk and toast, but when we asked for juice for our daughter, he brought us all a juice at no charge (in addition to our coffee.) Also - the coffee was very good, and my husband and I are really picky about our coffee. We always bring our won for the room coffeemaker. 6. AAA rate for our room was 129/night. Not bad for a harbor view and breakfast. HOWEVER - Cons- 1. NOISY!!! OMG, even with the windows closed, it was sooo noisy. My 9 yr. old, who normally doesn't even notice urban noise, complained about it. The trolley runs by CONSTANTLY. The Amtrak ran by twice within the first 2 hrs we were there in the evening. A plane flew overhead - really close. The pool was right below our room at ground level - and although we were on the 9th floor, we still heard kids in the pool at 8pm. In the morning, we heard the cruise ships blowing their horns. This was with the windows closed. 2. The TV reception on the 9th floor was awful. ALL OF THE CHANNELS were fuzzy. Not one station was clear. Not one, out of thirty-something channels. 3. Our room was cramped and small, and our bed was uncomfortable - sagged in the middle. The first two, for me, far outweighed the pros, and I don't think I'd be happy staying at this place for a week, or even a few days. Maybe if I was really on a budget, but I would not want to be in the room for long, even if it was non-smoking. I would assume that a lot of hotels downtown and by the harbor would be noisy, but I haven't stayed at those, just this one, and, even with the view, I wasn't that impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Only Ok....”
Reviews.Author: TravelerS7
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night in March, and while it was ok as a place to sleep, I probably wouldn't return given all of the other choices nearby. The room was just ok, thought it was reasonably sized, with a big fridge, a big TV that didn't work (I didn't get in until late and was too tired to deal with it or to change rooms, so just didn't use the TV), two only moderately comfortable queen beds. Bathroom was a decent size but water pressure somewhat lacking. There is free wireless and it worked very well once I got the user name and password from the desk, which just took a phone call. The room was fairly quiet until construction started in the am, though I could hear some noise from the next room when they used the plumbing. I could also hear traffic noise, even on the 10th floor and with the balcony door closed. Cleanliness seemed to be average. The major problems: 1. PARKING! I am surprised none of the recent reviews mentioned this. I can only guess that the reviewers didn't have cars. There is a parking garage, and contrary to one recent review it is NOT free, though the $7 charge is fairly reasonable by big city standards. HOWEVER, the problem is that the garage is five stories tall, with NO elevator. By the time I arrived the only parking spaces left were on the top floor, so yes, I had to go up and down five flights of stairs, or walk through five levels of the garage, to get to or from my car. I wasn't warned about this by the desk when I checked in (there are three spaces near the lobby for check in but a big sign warns that you will be towed if you leave your car there for longer than 15 minutes), but I had to come back through the lobby to get to my room. Had they even warned me, I would have dropped my luggage in the lobby before driving up to the 5th floor (and then having to walk down five flights with the luggage.). Part of the issue here is that there is no bellman. You are on your own to deal with luggage. On top of that, there is low lighting and no security personnel in the garage, and the garage is very open to the streeet, so it felt a little bit uncomfortable walking through it alone, in addition to being tiring.(the hotel neighborhood isn't awful but it isn't the greatest in the world either). Finally, I wonder if the garage size is adequate for the hotel: the hotel certainly didn't seem very full, but I literally got the second to last space in the place. I wonder what they do if it fills up? Bottom line: this is a convienent location to walking and public transportation, so might be ok for those without cars, but NOT recommended for those with cars. 2. The Elevator: (in the hotel itself): Signs on the elevator said it was working only sporadically, and if it stopped or the door wouldn't close to call the desk on the elevator phone. It worked for me, but this was very disconcerting. The sign said it was 'safe, but a computer issue'. Not particularly reassuring, especially since I notice in prior reviews that it has been broken before. 3. Construction: this was mentioned by others. There was major construction both on the street right below my room, and a new building being built right next door. By 7:00 am, the noise was significant (fortunately I had an early flight). 4. Bayside view: I didn't have a bayside view, so I will have to take the word of others that they are worth the extra $$ charged for it (which is why I didn't take it). However, I am skeptical, and if you do pay extra for it, better get an upper floor: I looked right at some bayside view room balconies from the 5th floor of the garage (which is bayside from the hotel), and could see the same view they were seeing: a bit of bay, framed by three larger hotels in between me and the bay (and of course, they were also looking at the garage). In addition to that, the new building being constructed next door juts out in an L shape from the bayside of the hotel, so EVERY bay view room is going to have a view of a construction site to their right. (the new building being built is about the same height as the hotel). Just a warning not to expect too much. II was glad that I hadn't paid extra for it. In that regard, while I know nothing about the Holiday Inn up the street, it might be worth checking out for those who want views: since it blocks part of the Bayside's view I presume its view is much better!. 5. Pool: is in a very claustrophobic little courtyard; nothing special about it. I could deal with these negatives as I was only there one night, but all of them would really have started to grate on a longer stay. Not recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Bayside Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 555 West Ash Street, San Diego, CA 92101
